subject: Re: [junit] HtmlUnit vs jWebUnit
msgSnippet: Leon, Srini, jWebUnit is a wrapper around httpunit, which makes it more junit like to write testscripts for your webapplications. I d say give both HTMLUnit
messageBody:
Leon, Srini,

jWebUnit is a wrapper around httpunit, which makes it more junit like to
write testscripts for your webapplications. I'd say give both HTMLUnit
and jWebUnit a try for 1 or 2 pages and then pick one. Setting up
jWebUnit and HtmlUnit isn't that hard.

Of course, being a maintainer of jWebUnit, I'd really like it if you'd
use jWebUnit :-)

Martijn

Leon Pu wrote:

>
> Hi Srinivas,
>
> I am not similiar with HtmlUnit and jWebUnit, but I think HttpUnit is
> a good choice to test your java writen web application.
>
>
> Leon
>
> srinivas muthyala <j2eespecialist@...> wrote:
>
> Hi All,
> I am currently in the process of choosing a
> testing framework for testing our web application. I
> am inclined to use either HtmlUnit or jWebUnit, but
> not sure if one is better than the other.
>
> Appreciate if any of you can share your
> experience/thoughts.
>
>
> Thank you
> Srini
